awd_titl_txt: I-Corps: An Optimized Warehouse Robot Control Device
awd_abstract_narration:
This I-Corps project is based on the potential development of warehouse-robot optimization control devices for human-robot or fully-automated order picking preference decisions. The proposed technology is a hardware and software-integrated firmware warehouse robot control device. The technology can potentially work in hybrid, as well as in fully automated warehouse management and fulfillment centers. It is a proposed modular system including a control device with integrated artificial intelligence and machine learning and is designed to potentially improve warehouse efficiency and productivity. The innovation focuses on two important aspects of hybrid/human and fully automated warehouse optimization: waste reduction and efficiency or productivity improvement challenges.

The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is the development of a warehouse robot control device to potentially optimize order picking preferences for fully automated eCommerce management. The commercialization opportunities of the device include the global warehouse automation industry. In general, organizations in this industry experience an average of two periods of unscheduled downtime over three years. The cost of unplanned downtime is between $10,000 to $250,000 per hour. As an operational efficiency system, this technology could impact global supply chain issues and possibly provide a more reliable and faster service for all of eCommerce.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
MULTI-BOT-OPT: An Optimized Warehouse Robot Control Device

NSF I-Corps National Team Grant Project Oitcomes Report

Paul Ranky: TL/PI, Roberta Carrassi and Christian Leone (ELs), and Ivan Domingues (IM), NJIT Team

MULTI-BOT-OPT is a hardware and software integrated firmware warehouse robot control device. In more detail, it is a multi-bot integrated warehouse-robot teaming optimization control device for human and for fully automated order picking preference optimization. It can work in hybrid, as well as in fully automated warehouse management and fulfillment centers. It is a modular system, a control device, with integrated AI and ML (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning), that can improve warehouse efficiency and productivity by about 30%.

We are focusing on the two most important aspects of hybrid / human and fully automated warehouse optimization / waste reduction / efficiency and productivity improvement challenges.

These are the two major system components of our warehouse robot control device:

1. A Multi-bot Integrated Warehouse-bot Teaming Optimization System for Human / Automated Hybrid Fulfillment Centers

and

2. A Robot Integrated Order Picking Preference Optimization (OPPO) System For Fully Automated eCommerce Management

The MULTI-BOT control device (patent application filed with NJIT), is a system component of our warehouse robot control device, that is capable of optimizing the workload between human operators and robots working in harmony with warehouse-bots, in other words special purpose warehouse robots in warehouses / automated / semi-automated fulfillment centers. 

Obviously in such facilities the pace between humans and robots are dynamically and real-time changing depending on the orders, the fulfillment mix, the task allocations, the processing times and precedence rules for the selected time period. (Note, that these time periods can be as short as the shortest processing time for a robot! In warehouse management this means really fast, like a few seconds…). 

This invention, a novel warehouse-bot control system integrated firmware device / system real-time optimizes human-warehouse bot / robot teaming operations to reduce waste, to increase productivity, to increase throughput, to enable variable fulfillment orders, to decrease fulfillment time needed, to reduce operator training needs, and to deploy fulfillment center Multi-bot robots as a service. 


 


Last Modified: 07/04/2023
Modified by: Paul G Ranky
